text:
Crime and Punishment

Everything felt dead and silent, like the stones under his feet. Then, in the dim light at the end of the street, he spotted a crowd and heard voices shouting. In the center of that crowd was a carriage, and a light was shining in the street. 

“What’s going on?” Raskolnikov thought as he turned right and approached the crowd. He felt a strange grip on everything around him and smiled coldly when he realized what was happening. He had made up his mind to head to the police station, and he knew it would all be over soon.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov approaches a crowd in the dusk, feeling resolved to go to the police station as he recognizes the situation unfolding.
